code: @Manual{,   title = {a5r: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)},   author = {Enrico Spinielli and Felix Palmer and Claude Code {(Opus 4.5)}},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://euctrl-pru.github.io/a5r/}, }

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
text: a5r provides R bindings A5 pentagonal Discrete Global Grid System (DGGS). A5 hierarchical geospatial indexing system partitions Earth’s surface pentagonal cells. Unlike hexagonal systems like H3, A5 uses pentagons tile sphere without requiring special irregular cells.

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
text: Convert coordinates cell IDs Navigate cell hierarchy (parent/children) Compact uncompact cell sets Get cell boundaries areas Fast Rust implementation via extendr

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
text: can install development version a5r GitHub: Note: Building source requires Rust. Install via rustup.

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
code: library(a5r)  # Convert coordinates to a cell at resolution 5 cell <- lon_lat_to_cell(lon = 4.4, lat = 52.0, resolution = 5)  # Get the cell as hex string u64_to_hex(cell) #> [1] "63da000000000000"  # Get cell center cell_to_lon_lat(cell) #> $lon #> [1] 4.397673 #> $lat #> [1] 52.00187  # Get cell resolution get_resolution(cell) #> [1] 5  # Navigate hierarchy parent <- cell_to_parent(cell, NULL) children <- cell_to_children(cell, NULL)  # Compact children back to parent compact(children)

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
text: A5 unique characteristics: 12 base cells resolution 0 (pentagons dodecahedron) 4 children per cell resolutions (5 resolution 0→1) Cell area decreases ~4x per resolution level Resolution range: 0 30
code: # Get all base cells get_res0_cells()  # Get cell count at resolution 5 get_num_cells(5) #> [1] 15360  # Get cell area in square meters get_cell_area(10) #> [1] 33201823

title: Pentagonal Geospatial Indexing System (DGGS)
